intro: Lonchocarpus guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan urarí, is a leguminous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces pods containing seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in the understory of rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
